name: Introduction to Economics
description: This course provides an introduction to micro- and macroeconomics, economic theory, and the study of economic institutions.

name: Intermediate Microeconomics
description: This course covers the core principles and theories of microeconomics, including consumer and firm behavior, the behavior of markets, and the determinants of economic performance.

name: Intermediate Macroeconomics
description: This course covers the core principles and theories of macroeconomics, including economic growth and business cycles, money and banking, fiscal policy, and international economics.

name: Econometrics
description: This course covers the theory and practice of econometrics, including estimation of linear models, hypothesis testing, and forecasting.

name: Behavioral Economics
description: This course covers the principles of behavioral economics, including the psychology of decision making, the role of emotions and social norms, and the implications of economic behavior for public policy.
